content: The Lean 4 manual has a dot notation for example ( . + x) and while I can cut-paste the symbol and it works I cannot seem to guess the command that does it. Both \dot and \cdot seem to make something else, and its not a period either....
(Also I see lots of such one-off help quesitons under new members but perhaps there is a better stream for such pleas for help, happy to be told where things belong.)
I use cdot for this regularly. Perhaps post a #mwe? It can be tricky to get parentheses right with this notation.
Oh, yeah. :-) My fingers apparently remember this better than my brain, sorry!
James B. Wilson has marked this topic as resolved.
Also, if you copy a symbol into VS Code and then hover over it, it will tell you how to type it.
